headline: Anderson Cooper 360 Degrees
subHeadline: Former Playmate On Her Alleged Affair With Donald Trump; Former Playmate On Her Alleged Affair With Donald Trump, McDougal On Alleged Trump Affair. Aired 8-9p ET

utterances.speaker: ERIN BURNETT, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Appreciate you're taking the time and talking to us tonight.

utterances.speaker: DAVID MILIBAND, PRESIDENT, INTERNATIONAL RESCUE COMMITTEE
utterances.sentences: Thank you very much for your time.

utterances.speaker: BURNETT
utterances.sentences: And thanks very much to all of you for being with us tonight and this week. We'll be back here again on Monday as the Trump trial continues. Michael Cohen back on the stand still under cross- examination by Todd Blanche, and we'll see what that brings on Monday morning. Have a good weekend. AC360 begins right now.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Welcome to this special edition of AC360 the Karen McDougal interview.McDougal is one of the women at the center of former President Trump's hush money trial. She says they had an affair starting in 2006 that lasted around 10 months. The former president denies an affair with McDougal or a sexual relationship with Stormy Daniels. Karen McDougal was paid by the company that owns the National Enquirer for her story as part of a catch-and-kill scheme. I spoke to her about it back in 2018. Karen McDougal had never told her story on camera in full until this interview and she's never done an interview like it since. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: If we could just start at the beginning, how did you meet Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: KAREN MCDOUGAL, FORMER PLAYBOY MODEL
utterances.sentences: I met Donald when they were filming "The Celebrity Apprentice" at the Playboy Mansion. They were filming there and I was hired as one of the Playmates to work at the pool party scene. It was kind of fun, actually. And ...

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You worked for Playboy for some time.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes. I - after becoming Playmate of the Year, I was required to work so many events with Playboy. And that was one of the events that I thought would be fun. And I worked it and there were a lot of women there. And we just saw it as a great time and that's how we met. COOPER

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He said hello, like he would to anybody, and then throughout the night it was kind of obvious that there was an attraction from his part to me. And I kind of just blew it off.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You could see him looking at you.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I could see it. And the Playboy Bunny, she's like the house mom, is what we call her, she actually made a comment like, wow, this guy is really into you. And that's kind of when I started like paying attention. And he was. And I kind of smiled at it, I thought it was kind of cute and funny. And then at the end of the night, after striking up many conversations, we exchanged - he actually asked me to write his phone - my phone number down for him to keep.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you - you wanted to see him again?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I thought it would be nice to communicate with him and talk to him. I actually at that point didn't consider dating or going out with him. But I just think he's an interesting person. He's brilliant and I like smart minds. And I think that I was interested in the communications for sure.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So when was the next communication?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I believe we talked right away on the phone and I think we talked for about a week on the phone before his next visit to L.A. And that was his birthday which I think is June 12th.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Would he call you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He would call me. I would call him, vice versa.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So you had his phone number?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I have many of his phone numbers, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you have his direct number for him and did you have to go through somebody else?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I have his direct phone number. I have quite a few of the direct phone numbers. I also had his bodyguard - Keith's phone number. I had his personal secretary's phone number.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And what were the conversations like?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: The conversations were like any other conversation you have with a nice person. We got along great. We had respect for each other. We had fun. We were funny together. We had a good time.We would talk about anything and everything from what kind of food do you like, to how's your family - he asked me how my family was - to politics, to anything, like just normal everyday life conversations.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So, tell me about your first date. MCDOUGAL

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: In the actual restaurant?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Right. Well, we did have dinner at the Beverly Hills Hotel but in his bungalow instead. We had dinner there for a few hours. We talked for a few hours. We had a great time, we're getting to know each other. We're talking about his birthday, and then as the night ended, we were intimate.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: When you got to the Beverly Hills Hotel and Keith said, we're not going to go through the lobby, we're going to go - was it to a room at the Beverly Hills Hotel or a suite or ...

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It was a bungalow in back.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: A bungalow.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It's the one he said he always stayed at. And in fact, every time that I met him there, it was the same exact bungalow. And he's called it the nicest bungalow they have. So, I guess that's why he chose that one. But that's, yes, that's where we went every time.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Were you concerned when you realized you're not going to go out to dinner, you're actually going to be eating at the bungalow?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Were you attracted to him?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I was attracted to him, yes. He's a nice-looking man. And I liked his charisma. I think I love got great posture. He's got great posture. And he was nice.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So the sex was consensual? Just to be clear. MCDOUGAL

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And what happened afterward?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: After that night?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You said you sort of ended on a strange note. What happened after you had been intimate?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Well, after we had been intimate, he tried to pay me. And I actually didn't know how to take that.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did he actually try to hand you money?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He did. He did. And I said, I mean, I just had this look of, I don't know - just, I don't even know how to describe the look on my face must have been so sad, because I had never been offered money like that before, number one. But number two, I thought, does he think I'm in this for money or why I'm here tonight? Or is this a normal thing? I didn't know.But I looked at him and I said, that's not me. I'm not that kind of girl. And he said, oh, and he said, you're really special, and I was like, thank you. So, I left, actually, got in the car. Keith taking me home and I started crying. I was really sad. It really hurt me. But I went back.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Hurt you that I saw you that way?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Hurt me that he saw me in that light. And he obviously assumed that that's the kind of girl I was, maybe because I was a playmate. I don't know. But ...

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Even though you'd a night of conversation and days of conversations, it hurt you that it boiled down in the end to that.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It did hurt me. It did hurt me. I was crying in the back seat of the car. Like I said, I got home into my apartment and I cried for - a lot. I felt really terrible about myself, let alone what he felt, but I felt terrible about myself. And I got over it, but I did hurt.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you think you would see him again?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I didn't. I didn't think I'd see him again. But then when he called, I was in a bad place in my life. I just came out of a bad relationship where I never felt good enough in my relationship, and - not that that's any excuse, it's not. But I think I was so down on myself that when he called, and he's so sweet, like what everyone sees on TV, I didn't see in that man, because that man was very sweet, very respectful, very loving, very kind and caring. Like that's the man I saw.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He's very - he could be very charming in person.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He's very charming. He's very sweet. His personality to me was, wow, like I loved it. It was great.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: When was the next time you saw him?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I'd have to look back at my - like, I took a journal back in the day, and not for anything in particular, but I - to this day, I still write down everything I do during the day. That's what I do.So, if I looked at that, I could find out, but I think it was in that same couple days within a week, because he was in town. When he came to L.A., he was usually there between three, six, seven - between three, five, six, seven days and I usually saw him.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You gave us the journal that you kept. You would write down on days you saw him, you wouldn't write out his full name.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I either called him T or D.T., because if anybody found this, I wouldn't want to expose myself or expose him.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So there's a number of days here, looks like dozens over the course of time with a small little D.T. and sometimes they're hard to see.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I purposely kind of chicken scratched a lot on there, because I know what I'm writing. And like I said to this day, I still do that with my notes and where I'm at, who I talked to, whatever. I did. I did write that down.So, did I see him quite a few times? Quite a bit? Absolutely. We spent a lot of time together.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And did you tell friends about it at the time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I did. I told a few friends, and I told my sister. I actually told my mother that I knew him and we talked on a regular basis, but I told her that we were just friends. And she kind of scolded me a little bit, like I hope it's only friends, because, you know he's married and I'm like, yes, I understand.My sister actually heard him on the phone, she was with me one time and she - I couldn't hold the phone because I was busy. So, she put him on speaker and we were just talking. I mean, I didn't care. It's like, she knew anyway. So, when you have a relationship with somebody, you don't hide it, right? If there's feelings, you don't hide that relationship.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did he ever ask you to hide it?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, he didn't. Never. Actually ...

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So, there was never a conversation of don't tell anybody?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Never. In fact, I think once he asked, does your sister know? And I said, yes, she knows. He's like, oh. So, he wasn't afraid to hide it at all.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And you knew he was married.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I never brought up his wife. He did once. And that's only time I can remember, when he said she was an intelligent woman. She knew like, I don't know, four or five languages. But other than that, he never talked about his wife, and I never brought it up.I - obviously, there's a reason I don't bring her up because I felt guilty about it. So, I - after never seeing her until the one occasion, I never correlated the two, really. I just kind of out of sight, out of mind.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: When you met, it was 2006.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Was this shortly after his son had been born?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Would he talk about his child, his son?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No. The only thing he said about his son was, isn't the name Barron a nice name? And I said, yes, it is. And I said, how did you choose that name? And he told me, and that's it. There's no conversation.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: As you enter a relationship, obviously, in any relationship, you start to think about where this is going to go, and how you feel, and - how did you view it? How did you view the relationship?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Going through it, when I look back, where I was back then, I know it's wrong. Like I'm really sorry for that. I know it's the wrong thing to do.But back in those days - sorry.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It's okay.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Back in that day, I was a different girl, I had fun. I was in the Playboy scene. I was just enjoying life as much as I could.And when I got with him, actually, there was a - there was a real relationship there. There was real - there were feelings between the two of us. Not just myself, not just him. There was a real relationship there. And I kind of out of sight, out of mind with everything else. And deep inside, I did have a lot of guilt. But I still continued.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You believe, though, that he had real feelings for you? MCDOUGAL

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He would say that?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He did.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Were you in love with him?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I was, yes. Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And do you think he was in love with you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He was, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did Donald Trump ever say to you that he loved you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: All the time. He always told me he loved me. Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did he have any nicknames for you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He would call me "baby," or he'd call me "Beautiful Karen."

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Would you always see him just in Los Angeles?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No. No, I wouldn't.I actually went to a golf tournament with him in Lake Tahoe. I went to his golf course in California. I went to his golf course home in New Jersey. I went to his home in New York, and - I'm trying to think where else. I can't recall right now, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: When you say you would arrange to go someplace, how would it be arranged?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I would pay for the flight, I would book it myself. I would book the hotel room if I wasn't staying with him. Usually, I stayed with him, but there's been a couple times where I didn't. And then he would reimburse me. So, if the flight was, I don't know, I'll just throw the number, if the flight $500, he'd give me $500 and say, here's - take care of the flight and things like that. So ...

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why would he have you book all the travel and the hotel room?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Well, there's no paper trail.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And did you realize that at the time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Because he was concerned about it being revealed at some point and there being a paper trail?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Oh, I was told there is no paper trail. I can't say what his reasons were, but I would assume that's the case, yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You said you went to a golf tournament in Tahoe. MCDOUGAL

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: There were other people now who have come forward saying that they also had met with him and had sex with him at that event. Were you aware of any other women?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I was not. I mean, I was with him a lot, so I didn't see anything, but could he have stayed a day longer than me? Sure.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you think that this relationship was going to last for a long time? Did you have ...

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You did?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, I felt it was getting much stronger. There were no gifts ever, but a Christmas gift, I got him a gift. And then he told me the gift he got me was an apartment in New York, but it's being remodeled right now. And I never saw the apartment, because I ended up breaking up or ending the relationship, but that was supposedly my gift. I don't know.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You went to his actual apartment in Trump Tower.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What was it like going up to Trump Tower?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I didn't know I was at Trump Tower. We went to the back entrance, so I had no idea where we were going. The back entrance as you know, probably, is more discrete. It's like a little nothing hallway versus like when you walk into the grand - right?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: So we went into the back entrance and then at that time I realized where we were going, and I said, aren't you afraid to bring me here. He's like, they won't say anything. I'm like okay. So, we went upstairs and we looked around and ...

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: To his office or to his apartment?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: His apartment. He showed me around.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What did you think of the apartment?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It's very gold. No, actually - it's actually quite pretty. The views are amazing. That's a beautiful apartment. They have great taste.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And he showed you around the apartment?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He did.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did he reference Melania at that point?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: One of the reasons Karen McDougal says she wanted to set the record straight was that Donald Trump through his then longtime aide Hope Hicks denied any relationship with her. McDougal talks about that coming up in this part of our 2018 interview.Before the break she was recounting how during her alleged affair with Trump she says he actually took her into his apartment at Trump Tower when his family wasn't home. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: We passed a room and he said it's Melania's room. She likes to have her alone time or to get her way to read or something like that. I'm like, oh, okay. That's when I kind of thought, maybe they're having issues. I didn't ask. It's not my business at that point.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: How did you feel being in his apartment?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Guilty, very guilty.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Guilty.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why guilty?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I kind of didn't - I couldn't wait to get out of the apartment, actually. I think doing something - but then when you're doing - or doing something wrong is bad enough, and when you're doing something wrong, and you're in the middle of somebody else's home or bed or whatever, that just puts it a little old stab in your heart, and I just couldn't wait to get out of the apartment. I wanted to go back to my hotel room.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: It made his other life more real, you think?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I was going to say, it made it more real to me, yes. It made it more real.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you see Barron there?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I never saw Barron.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So, where's this picture from? MCDOUGAL

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So, this is a picture with Ivanka Trump, Melania Trump, several of your colleagues and yourself.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did - so, was that the first time you met Melania?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It is. And honestly, if you can tell, I tried to keep my distance. I tried to go as far away as I could, just because I felt guilty.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you think she knew?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Maybe. Maybe. I don't know.It was told to me that they were arguing that night, and I said, why. And somebody had said, probably because of you. But I don't know if that's a fact or not, so don't quote me on that one.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you - there's another picture with - it's you with Eric Trump.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you know where that is from?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I believe is that's from the Trump Vodka release party that he had, which was within a couple of days of that other party.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did it feel strange to meet his son, Eric?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It did, but he was such a friendly guy. Like, again, when you're doing something wrong, you try and push everything out of the way and make it as right as you can in your mind. So I met all his kids, except for Barron, of course. And I just started to shake it. But now, it gets to me, but then it didn't.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did he ever compare you to any of his kids?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He's very proud of Ivanka, as he should be. I mean, she's a brilliant woman. She's beautiful. She's - that's his daughter and he should be proud of her.He said I was beautiful like her and you're a smart girl. And there wasn't a lot of comparing, but there was some, yes. I heard a lot about her. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did that strike you as odd in any way, or?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I know a lot of people think it's odd. I - there's been some comments I've heard in the news he's said about her and I think those comments are wrong. But do I think it's strange that a father would love his daughter so much that he brags about her? No, I brags about my dog that much.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: I guess - some people seeing this are not going to believe that you had a relationship, Hope Hicks has said categorically you did not have a relationship.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: There's no truth to this. When you heard that denial, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Well, I think somebody's lying, and I can tell you it's not me. It's a little hurtful, but at the same time, I have to understand, like if he were to told Hicks - Hope that he didn't do it, I guess I understand, because he's trying to protect his family, his image. Things like that. But, it was definitely a little, like, wow, you're going to lie about that? Like, okay.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: When you heard the stories of Stormy Daniels who has come forward who said that she was at the Tahoe Club as well and others who said that they were there, you didn't know about that at the time.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Does it - what did you think when you heard that?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: This is special edition of 360, the Karen McDougal interview. Along with Stormy Daniels, Karen McDougal at the center, former President Trump's ongoing hush money trial.She spoke to me back in 2018 and revealed for the first time on camera the full story about her alleged relationship with Trump, which she says began in 2006 and about the payment for her silence brokered through the parent company of the National Enquirer. Karen McDougal has never spoken about it in such detail on camera since. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you think maybe this would lead to a marriage?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That's something, though, you liked him enough? That's something you would have liked?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: COPPER
utterances.sentences: Did he, at the time, say -- tell you that you were his only girlfriend or did that subject matter?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: You know, we never really discussed that. I knew he talked to ladies, but I didn't know there was anything else. I didn't know he was intimate with other ladies. But I guess if he's -- makes sense, if he's doing it behind his wife's back, why would he not do it behind my back? So --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: But at that time, in the frame of mind you were in then, you felt you were the only love one person?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I thought I was the only one. Yes. I did. I thought I was the only one.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you have any text messages, photographs, videos, anything that would dispute the Hope Hicks's statement that this never happened?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Let me just say this. If you're in a loving relationship, do you try and collect evidence?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That's not what you were thinking about?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, not at all. Not at all. In fact, the only thing that I have really is my journal that I keep. And like I said, I still do it to this day. It wasn't out to get anybody or, gosh, getting anyone in trouble. But those are my notes. Those are from me. No. When you care about somebody, you don't try and set them up in any way, shape or form. That's my opinion.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And then this is a hard question to ask and -- but you said you had texted that first time. All these times you saw him, this was an ongoing sexual relationship?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Can you estimate how many times you actually saw him?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Again, when you're in a relationship, do you count how many times you have sex? No. However, I can tell you we saw each other a minimum five times a month, up to bigger numbers per month. So we --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Over the course of how long?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Over the course of 2006 through -- I think I ended the relationship April 2007. So we were together 10 months before I chose to end it. So we saw each other quite frequently.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So dozens of times you were together --

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Many dozens of times, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: -- and you were intimate?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Many dozens of times?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: This is another tough question. And again, you don't have to answer it, but it's been raised with other people. Did he ever use protection?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No. No, I didn't.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Was that something you thought about or it didn't concern you at the time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: You know, we talked about it right beforehand. He was starting to, and then he's like, I don't like these things. And, you know, we discuss things. Do you do, blah, blah, blah. And we were just honest with each other. And we didn't use any.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You talked about ending the relationship. Who ended the relationship?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I was just feeling so guilty. It was just digging inside me. I think the excitement of it took over for a while. And I did care about the man, I'm not going to lie. So that made it hard to end it. But I think I just started feeling so bad about myself. Like, how could I do this to, A, myself, but to B, to a family? Whether they get along or not, it's still a family.I just needed to get out of it. You know, I just needed to get out of it. It just was tearing me apart in the long run.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That's a hard thing to do to end a relationship, any relationship.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It was very hard. But I knew I needed to get out.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you ever think about rekindling the relationship?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Not while he's married, no. Yes, of course I did. I had feelings for the guy, but not when -- I could -- no, not while he was married. At that point in time, I would never do that again. No.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You didn't speak -- I mean, you told friends, as anybody would tell friends about a relationship.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: But you didn't at any point during this time, 2006, 2007, 2008, try to reach out, or did you at any point after the relationship ended, think about telling your story publicly?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Never.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Telling about the relationship? I mean, some people would have considered telling their story. That never crossed your mind?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No. When you have a -- when you have feelings in a relationship and you cared about somebody, why would you want to destroy their life any more than you might have already destroyed their life? So --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: At what point did -- I mean, obviously, Donald Trump announces for president. He's going to run. He gets the Republican nomination. At what point does this start to come back or this become suddenly in the forefront for you again?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I was watching the republican debate with a friend named Johnny (sp). He's one of my good friends from many years ago. He said, you know, the story is a big story. And I said, no way. It's not going to happen. I go, you know where I stand on this, Johnny (sp). I will never say anything. We dropped it.And of course, Johnny (sp) is a Democrat, and -- but I'm a Republican, so --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You're a Republican?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I am. And I voted for Donald. Yes, I did. There you have it. Yes, diehard Republican. So we dropped it. But then later on, maybe a week or two later, an ex-friend or an old friend of mine started on social media talking about my relationship. And she was part of that. She knows everything.She had started putting it out there, so it was being seen. So I came to Johnny (sp) one day and I said, Johnny (sp), look what she's doing. I said, do I need to worry about this? And he's like, absolutely, you do. He said, you need to get ahead of the story now before everyone else takes your story and manipulates it any way they want to manipulate it and make it this very ugly thing. You need to control your story and you need to tell your truth. And I said, yes, you're right. So that's what we decided to do. And that's where Johnny (sp) one day comes over and he's like, you know, our mutual friend that we have found this guy named Keith. And he's going to help you share your story.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Keith Davidson.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: An attorney?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: An attorney who also was an attorney for Stormy Daniels?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I didn't know that. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And others in this business?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Clearly.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So what did you do then? You contacted Davidson?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I didn't. Johnny (sp) did. Johnny (sp) and the mutual friend contacted Davidson. Within a matter of a couple days, Keith came out and we all had lunch together, and he wanted to know details. So we sat down at lunch for a couple hours. I gave him details. And Keith was like, you know, this story is worth many, many millions. And I'm like, hmm, okay. So we talked about it. And that's when Keith brought it to AMI.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So did you know that Keith, your attorney, was going to go to AMI, which is the parent company which owns National Enquirer and other magazines?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: He said AMI. I didn't know what AMI was, to be honest. He said, AMI, we have this company that, you know, they'll probably want to hear your story. So --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And what was the thought of selling the story in your mind?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: To get my truth out there. I wasn't looking for money, clearly. But when he said, it's worth many millions, I'm like, you know --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That was something that was hard to pass up?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Sure. Of course.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did Keith have a meeting with AMI? Did you have a meeting with AMI?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: We did. We had a meeting with AMI.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You told them your story?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: We told them the story. They actually didn't think it was very credible, even though, off the record, they said Dylan believes your story. But clearly, when they came back, they said it wasn't believable. I'm like --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Dylan being --

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Dylan Howard, he's with AMI. So they had, like, a 12-hour window to -- I know I'm probably skipping around. I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: That's (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: They had a 12-hour window to accept whether they wanted the story or not. And they didn't want the story. Well, then the Republican -- he won the Republican nomination and AMI was interested in the story again.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Once Donald Trump won the republican nomination --

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Right. Correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: -- you're saying AMI suddenly came back to you with interest of your story?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Well, to Keith, yes. To us for the story, Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why do you think it was that it was after Donald Trump was the Republican nominee that they came back?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: They wanted to squash the story.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You're saying they wanted to protect Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I'm assuming so, Yes. [20But the offer, which we didn't discuss yet or haven't discussed, was, you know, they had offered me a big, you know, contract for work, for modeling, and fitness, and things like that. My life has always been health and fitness, so --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: They said they were going to have you be a columnist. You would write columns about health and fitness?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct. They said I'd write columns. I would get one article per month in OK Magazine, one article per month in Star Magazine for two years, and then four columns per month on RadarOnline for two years. On top of that, two magazine covers.And their reasoning was like, you know, you've been a successful model, fitness, etcetera. We want to help you continue and we actually want to rebrand you. And, you know, you're older now, so we want to jump start into a new career for you and really get you out there to work. And I'm like, this is perfect. Like, who doesn't -- what model wouldn't want that, especially as an older model? Like, you're like, oh, this is great, right? So, Yes. But then the side deal was, oh, we're squashing the story. OK, it's a win-win for me. Like, I get the work and my story doesn't have to come out.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did you know that they were buying the life rights to your story?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I did. I knew I could never talk about him. Sure.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So that was -- for you, this wasn't a non-disclosure agreement? To you, this was a great business opportunity. You're going to get paid. You're going to be able to have write columns. You're going to kind of launch a new aspect of your career. You're going to get the cover of some magazines. And on top of it, you're going to sell them your story, but they're not going to publish it. And therefore --

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: -- there's not going to be any ramifications to the story getting out?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. I mean, who wouldn't want to get this work? And then that work could leave to other work or to other work. Who knows where it could lead? Of course, I was excited.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So in essence, you were happy to have the story killed?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes, of course. Like I said, I never wanted to come forward.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And you were going to get $150,000 for it, for having it killed and launching potentially a new career? MCDOUGALthe columns, the covers, and I'm getting paid for that. Oh, and my life story never has to be shared. It was more about the way it was presented. It was more about protecting me. It was more about, we don't want to tarnish your image, we want to keep your brand wholesome and whole. So I'm like, that's awesome. You know, that's great. So that's the way I perceive this contract. It was a win-win, like I said. It's a win-win.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Had you ever heard the term at that point, catch and kill?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I had not.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you know what catch and kill is now?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I do now. Yes, I do now.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What's your understanding of what catch and kill is?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: From what I'm learning, a catch and kill is somebody for, like, say for yourself, for example, taking a story about somebody you like or care about or have a friendship about, and they squash a story so it doesn't hurt you, don't hurt them.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So did you know that that's what was going or that's the allegation of what was going on here? Did you realize that at the time?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I knew the story wasn't going to be printed. Yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Why do you think they squashed the story?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Back then or now?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: P Now.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: They didn't want to hurt him.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You think it's because of a personal relationship with the guy who runs AMI is friends with Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you think -- I mean, you wouldn't know this, but do you think Donald Trump would have been aware of this deal that they were doing him -- that they were allegedly doing him this favor?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't know. But based on what I'm learning, as we're all learning together, as we read, and one of the big complaints with why I think my contract is illegal, is because his attorney was talking to my attorney. So --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You're saying Donald Trump's personal attorney, Michael Cohen?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Correct. Speaking with Keith.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: He Was talking with to Keith Davidson, your attorney?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Without me even knowing, without my knowledge, I would assume that maybe he knew. I know his attorney did. I can't say that he knew, but his attorney (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: How do you know that Michael Cohen and your attorney, Keith Davidson, were in communication?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I didn't know. I'm just learning this as you're learning this. It's been reported. And my attorney is -- they know.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: And to you, the idea that Michael Cohen would be in communication with your attorney at the time. Theoretically, there would be no reason for Michael Cohen to be having communication with your attorney because this was a deal between Keith Davidson, you, and AMI?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: How quickly was the AMI deal done?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Once we agreed upon the jobs, the financial payment and things like that, it was done very quickly in a matter of a day or two. Basically, I was going out of town and I said, I'll get back to you in a week. When I get back into town, they said, the deal really needs to be done now. I'm like, OK. So I think it was done within that night or the next day.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you remember what day this was or what -- when this was in the presidential race?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It was in August. I signed the deal August 6th, so it was probably August 5th or 4th that we finalized and then signed on the 6th. But I can't tell you. I don't remember where the race was, so --

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So this is in the last month or two of the presidential race?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Yes. Mm-hmm, mm-hmm.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you think the presidential race had anything to do with this deal getting done?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: When I'm looking back at it now, possibly, yes.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: If Donald Trump hadn't been running for president, do you believe this deal would have been made with AMI knowing what you know now?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Probably not. No. Probably not.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You're pretty -- you're convinced now this was an effort to do a favor for Donald Trump in the last few months of the presidential race?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: At the time of my interview with Karen McDougal in 2018, she'd filed a lawsuit against AMI, the parent company of the National Enquirer, to release her from that contract, which bought her silence but also promised her a number of opportunities with their publications.She said David Pecker and AMI hadn't held up their end of the bargain. Weeks after this interview, she settled that suit and was released from her contract. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: You know, some people hearing that are going to say, look, you want -- this is -- you're in it for the money. They're going to say, OK, obviously we are not paying you for this interview. We don't pay for interviews. But you may go from here and write a book, or make a movie, or whatever it may be. To that, you say what?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Bottom line is this. I've offered to give back the $150,000, even though I only got 55% of that. I've offered to give back the $150,000 just to have my story rights back.The story is out there now. I'm not telling the nitty-gritty details. As you can see, I'm very selective in what I'm saying about our relationship. I'm not out to make money on this. I'm out to get my rights back, to prove a contract was illegal, that I was taken advantage of, and then go back to my life, period.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Did it anger you? I mean, is part of this because people at the White House have said, you're lying, you're not telling the truth?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I don't -- no one likes to be called a liar, but no, it's more about the illegal portion of the contract and them not fulfilling what they promised me. They promised me this work.To date, there are only 10 articles on OK magazine, 10 articles in Star magazine, and maybe 7 on RadarOnline. RadarOnlnie, I'm supposed to get four per month. I mean, the two years is up in August. I've gotten really nothing out of this.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: So you think that whole talk of helping you relaunch kind of a new -- a whole new phase of your career --

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It was fake. They didn't want to help me. I thought they wanted to keep my reputation clean. From what they said, they wanted to rebrand me. They wanted to, you know, I'm an older model now. They wanted to make something a new start. You know, they promised me all these wonderful, beautiful things.Even when I met with David Pecker, and Dylan, and Keith in New York after -- this was back last August, they offered me many more opportunities, but I haven't seen anything yet. Not that -- that's not part of the contract, but my point is, they keep dangling the carrot. I'm not playing that game anymore.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Are you aware of, or have you spoken to any women with similar stories who have come forward?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: No, I haven't spoken to anyone. I know other, I've heard other stories from other people, but it's hearsay. It's not like the girl directly to me. But no, I can't comment on that.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Would you have come forward publicly if Stormy Daniels hadn't come forward? Do you think that made an impact on you?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: I definitely think it made a little bit of an impact on me. It gives you more -- it takes a little bit of the fear away. However, I probably would have just because as I'm learning about this contract and the people involved and the way I was treated, and all the behind the scenes things that I wasn't aware about, and all the work I'm not getting, which I contracted for, yes, I probably would have come forward.If you didn't get what you were told in a contract work-wise, wouldn't you say something? Of course.

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Do you have any regrets about the relationship that you said you had with him?

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: Back then?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: The only regret I have about the relationship that I had with Donald was the fact that he was married. If he weren't married, I wouldn't have any regrets because he treated me very kind. He was very respectful. As I told you, it was a good relationship while it happens.Now, had I known at the time, there were supposedly all these other women, no, I wouldn't have been in the relationship, but I didn't know that at the time. So, no, no regrets, except the fact that he was married.

utterances.speaker: MCDOUGAL
utterances.sentences: It's a tough one.
